summary: The National Guard Proper Use Act (H.R. 5604) prohibits members of the Armed Forces and the National Guard from enforcing or supporting the enforcement of immigration laws. It amends titles 10 and 32 of the United States Code, referencing the Posse Comitatus Act (18 U.S.C. §1385). The bill aims to restrict the military's role in immigration enforcement, focusing on the separation of military duties and immigration law enforcement.
